page.title: 01Overview of Willoughby
page.content: The D block is a fertile expanse of land extending from the foot of the Lincolnshire Wolds on its western boundary to the fertile coastal plain which forms the majority of the block. There are three hamlets, Mawthorpe, Farlesthorpe and Well in the block. The southern boundary bisects the village of Willoughby, the description of which is covered by the adjacent southern block surveyed by the village Primary School. The major landscape feature is the wooded land to the west rising to about 45 metres, the remnants of the parkland around Well House, a large estate and historic house occasionally open to the public. The area is cut by the line of the old G.N.R. Grimsby - Boston railway and the branch line to Mablethorpe. Both are now closed and the track bed sold off.
